entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs Central Bank Raises Economic Growth Projection: Business Week Armenia

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs Central Bank Raises Economic Growth Projection: Business Week Armenia
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenia‚Äôs Central Bank lowered its benchmark interest rate for the first time in more than two years, as inflation in the country continues to ease. üìçArmenia‚Äôs monetary authorities hiked the country‚Äôs projected economic growth this year to almost 7%. üìçA senior Armenian official did not deny the accuracy of reports that some Armenian banks have started to block Russian firms from making payments for electronics imports.
Credits: Ruptly
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #civilnetbusiness

entry.title: No Humanitarian Aid to Karabakh: Azerbaijan Tightens Blockade of the Region

media:group.media:title: No Humanitarian Aid to Karabakh: Azerbaijan Tightens Blockade of the Region
media:group.media:description:
üìçStepanakert said dialogue with Baku is ‚Äúunrealistic‚Äù after Azerbaijan closed the Lachin corridor checkpoint to all traffic, including humanitarian aid. üìçAzerbaijan continued shelling the Armenian border village of Yeraskh,Armenia‚Äôs Defense Ministry reported. üìçThe prosecutors general of Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Russia met for talks in Saint Petersburg. üìçArmen Ashotyan, a prominent Armenian opposition figure, has been detained on charges of abuse of power and money laundering. He denies the accusations.
Credits: Ruptly
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #dailyarmenia

entry.title: Special Report: Tensions Soar as Baku Blocks Humanitarian Aid to Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Special Report: Tensions Soar as Baku Blocks Humanitarian Aid to Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
üìçTensions between Yerevan and Baku continued to escalate today when Azerbaijani border guards began blocking Red Cross and peacekeeper vehicles from delivering humanitarian aid to Nagorno-Karabakh. üìçArmenian border guards thwarted an attempt by Azerbaijani border guards to advance into Armenian territory near the Lachin corridor, according to Armenia‚Äôs National Security Service. üìçThe country‚Äôs security service reported one Armenian border guard was injured when an Azerbaijani serviceman opened fire on the Armenian village of Tegh. Details of the guard‚Äôs condition have not been made public. üìçDiplomats from more than three dozen countries visited the Armenian village of Yeraskh, which has come under Azerbaijani fire three times just this week. Yesterday, two Indian nationals were injured when Azerbaijani units shelled the village.
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’©

entry.title: EU Mission On Armenia‚Äôs Border: What To Know

media:group.media:title: EU Mission On Armenia‚Äôs Border: What To Know
media:group.media:description:
Markus Ritter, the head of the European Union Mission in Armenia, sits down with CivilNet to discuss the mission‚Äôs activities, functions and future plans. Ritter also clarifies information about the mission‚Äôs operational centers across Armenia and its communication mechanisms with Brussels and Baku.

media:group.media:title: Aliyev‚Äôs 6-Month Blockade of Artsakh
media:group.media:description:
In the latest episode of Insights with Eric Hacopian, Eric discusses Azerbaijan‚Äôs recent military aggression on the Armenian village of Yeraskh, which targeted a metallurgical plant that is being built with American investment. Eric also talks about Baku‚Äôs decision last week to postpone peace talks in Washington and how that may be connected with Ukraine‚Äôs ongoing counteroffensive in its war with Russia. He also reviews the situation in Artsakh, now that Azerbaijan‚Äôs blockade has passed the six-month mark.
